description: From social (“pertaining to high society”) +‎ -ite, perhaps as a play on social light, in imitation of words in -ite.

entries.meaning: A person (often a woman) of social prominence, considered to be an influential figure.
A person who goes to fashionable parties and is often written about in the newspapers, etc.
examples: Goodnight all you socialites don't wait up for me.
